meanings.sent1: The knot was so inextricable that I had to cut it.
meanings.sent2: The bond between the two friends was truly inextricable.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle the mess of wires was an inextricable challenge.
meanings.sent4: Their destinies seemed inextricable, intertwined like threads in a tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The mystery was inextricable, leaving everyone puzzled.

meanings.definition: Incapable of being escaped or avoided.
meanings.sent1: The inextricable truth finally caught up with him.
meanings.sent2: The consequences of his actions were inextricable.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to avoid the inextricable situation only made it worse.
meanings.sent4: The inextricable debt loomed over him like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The inextricable fate awaited him at the end of the road.
